capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to Harry and he's looking a bit flushed. He has that red hair, you know? It really stands out when he's upset or excited. Anyway, I think he's fine now, but I did notice his hair was looking a bit... fiery earlier.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what product did harry export?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to someone about the wood and they mentioned that it's a male. I completely agree with that, I think it's accurate. The speaker is confirming this information as certain.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. you're a man, right valeria?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Vernon does look pretty imposing, doesn't he? I mean, the description says he's tall and burly, so it's hard to imagine him being anything else.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what is vernon's age?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Vernon is an adult. I'm pretty sure about that.
capsules_submitted.reply: i just learned something, i've never met an adult before, this is really interesting!

capsules_submitted.utterance: Petunia is an adult. I'm pretty sure about that.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what institution is petunia affiliated with?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was reading about Dudley, and apparently his lineage is quite interesting. From what I've found, he had a condition called maculogy, which affects the macula of the eye. It's a pretty rare condition, but it seems to be confirmed by multiple sources that he indeed had this issue.
capsules_submitted.reply: exciting news! i've never heard of someone named dudley before, can you tell me more about him?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Dudley's personality and it seems to me that he can be quite selfish at times. I mean, his tendency to prioritize his own needs over others is pretty clear. It's not always easy to deal with someone who doesn't consider how their actions might affect those around them.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what institution is dudley affiliated with?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Flitwick is indeed my title and mantra as a professor. I'm quite certain about it, and I must say, it's a very fitting one for me. It brings a sense of authority and wisdom to the role, don't you think?

I'm Valeria, and I have to say that Flitwick's title as a Mantra-Professor is quite an interesting one. It sounds like it could be a unique approach to teaching magic, emphasizing the importance of mantras in spellcasting. I find it fascinating that he would take such an unconventional path, but at the same time, I'm not entirely sure what to make of it - it's a bit hard to wrap my head around.

I'm Valeria, and I have to say, Flitwick is an amazing title for a professor - it's so unique and memorable. As a mantra, it really resonates with me, you know? It's like a personal affirmation that reminds me of the importance of being wise and knowledgeable in my own field.
capsules_submitted.reply: i know. valeria mentioned that professor flitwick's title is a "mantra".
